DOCNAME: CASE OF ISMETA BACIC v. CROATIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant instituted civil proceedings before ORG ( PERSON u ORG ) against her former employer , ORG ( Poljoprivredni kombinat Zelina ) , challenging her dismissal from work and seeking payment of her salary for the period of her unemployment . The first - instance judgment of DATE , granting the applicant 's claims , awarded the applicant CARDINAL NORP kunas ( HRK ) together with statutory default interest .
The judgment was upheld by ORG PERSON ) on DATE .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , in a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG ( Trgovački sud u GPE ) opened bankruptcy proceedings against the applicant 's former employer and invited all creditors to submit their claims to the bankruptcy administrator , appointed to the case by the GPE commercial Court , within DATE . This was published in ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE .
CARDINAL . Examination hearings before ORG were held on DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged her claim , recognised by a final judgment , with ORG before which the bankruptcy proceedings against her former employer had meanwhile been opened . The applicant argued that , since the civil proceedings she had instituted against her former employer before the ordinary courts ( that is to say the competent municipal and county courts ) had been pending , she considered that her claim had been adequately secured . In this connection she pointed to the provision obliging the regular courts to discontinue civil proceedings concerning any debtor against whom bankruptcy proceedings had been opened in the meantime .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the applicant 's request inadmissible as lodged out of time . It found that the examination hearing ( ispitno ročište ) had been held on DATE and that after the expiry of DATE from that date no further claims could be lodged in the bankruptcy proceedings . The relevant part of the decision reads as follows :
“ In the bankruptcy proceedings against ORG ... examination hearing was held and concluded on DATE .
The above - mentioned creditor submitted her claim on DATE , outside the DATE period following the first examination hearing .
Since the claim was submitted too late , that is to say after DATE following the first examination hearing , it is to be dismissed pursuant to section CARDINAL paragraph CARDINAL of LAW . ”

CARDINAL . In her appeal lodged on DATE the applicant stressed , inter alia , that the bankruptcy administrator had failed to comply with her duty under LAW paragraph CARDINAL of LAW to include the applicant 's claim in the list of claims of all the current and former employees of the debtor company and to submit it for her signature .
CARDINAL . On DATE the High Commercial Court ( ORG trgovački sud PERSON ) upheld the first - instance decision . In so far as relevant it held as follows :

“ Under LAW paragraph CARDINAL of LAW , in a decision on opening of bankruptcy proceedings a bankruptcy panel is obliged to invite all creditors to submit their claims to the administrator within a fixed time - limit , in accordance with the provisions of LAW . The time - limit for submission of claims has to be fixed to DATE and no longer than DATE .
Claims submitted after the fixed time - limit may be examined at an examination hearing on the initiative of the administrator .

Claims submitted after the fixed time - limit which have not been examined at the examination hearing , as well as claims submitted within DATE of the first examination hearing but not after the call for the final hearing has been published may be examined at CARDINAL or more additional examination hearings which are to be scheduled by the administrator pursuant to a proposal made by the creditors who have failed to submit their claims on time , and on condition that they pay in advance and within DATE the costs of such a hearing .

Claims submitted after the expiry of the time - limit fixed in CARDINAL paragraph CARDINAL of LAW are to be declared inadmissible ( argument under LAW CARDINAL paragraphs CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW ) .

The first - instance court acted exactly as described above , in compliance with LAW , when it declared inadmissible as being lodged out of time the claim submitted by the creditor ORG from GPE . The appellant does not dispute that the examination hearing in the bankruptcy proceedings against debtor ORG based in PERSON was held and concluded on DATE . The conditions for submitting creditors ' claims then ceased to exist and it is therefore of no significance whether the appellant submitted her claim on DATE or DATE . In any event it was submitted out of time .
The only decision that a court could have adopted in such circumstances is the CARDINAL pursuant to section CARDINAL paragraph CARDINAL of LAW that the claim had to be declared inadmissible .

Therefore , there has been no wrongful application of LAW provisions to the appellant 's detriment and the impugned decision ought to be upheld in accordance with section CARDINAL paragraph CARDINAL ) of LAW in conjunction with section CARDINAL of LAW . ”

CARDINAL . NORP In her subsequent constitutional complaint the applicant argued that the administrator had failed to comply with her duty to inform her of the bankruptcy proceedings and allow her to lodge her claim against her former employer and had thus prevented her from securing the payment of her claim . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's complaint as being ill - founded . The relevant part of its decision reads as follows :

“ The impugned judgment and the case file show that [ the first ] examination hearing in the bankruptcy proceedings against ORG based in PERSON was held and concluded on DATE and that the applicant as a creditor submitted her claim after the first examination hearing , on DATE .

Since the applicant submitted her claim after the time - limit fixed in LAW paragraph CARDINAL of LAW , the first - instance court declared her claim inadmissible as being lodged out of time pursuant to CARDINAL paragraph CARDINAL of LAW .

ORG , in its decision on the applicant 's appeal , stressed that the appeal was unfounded and that ORG had correctly applied substantial law when it had declared the applicant 's claim inadmissible as being lodged out of time . ”
CARDINAL . LAW ( Stečajni zakon , ORG nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL , as applicable at the relevant time ) in the relevant parts provided as follows :
“ [ After the bankruptcy proceedings have been opened ] the bankruptcy administrator [ assigned to the case ] shall represent the debtor . ”

“ In a decision on opening of the bankruptcy proceedings creditors shall be invited to submit their claims to the administrator , within a fixed time - limit . The time limit shall be fixed to PERCENT fifteenCARDINAL days and no longer than a month . ”
“ All claims [ against a debtor in bankruptcy proceedings ] become payable when the bankruptcy proceedings are opened . ”
“ The administrator [ assigned to the case ] shall intervene on behalf of the debtor in all pending civil proceedings concerning disputes about the debtor 's assets . ”
“ Bankruptcy creditors shall enforce their claims against the debtor in bankruptcy proceedings only . ”
“ ( CARDINAL ) Bankruptcy creditors shall submit CARDINAL copies of their claims to the bankruptcy administrator together with supporting documents confirming the existence of their claims .

( CARDINAL ) The bankruptcy administrator shall make a list of all claims which have become due before the opening of the bankruptcy proceedings of the present and former debtor 's employees and submit the list to then be signed and the claims approved by the employees concerned ...
“ ( CARDINAL ) At the examination hearing the claims submitted shall be examined according to the amounts claimed and their rank .
( CARDINAL ) The administrator shall expressly state whether he accepts or contests each of the claims submitted .
“ ( CARDINAL ) Claims submitted after the fixed time - limit may be examined at a request of the bankruptcy administrator .

( CARDINAL ) Claims submitted after the fixed time - limit which have not been examined at the examination hearing , as well as the claims submitted within threeCARDINAL DATE of the first examination hearing , but not after the call for the final hearing has been published , may be examined at CARDINAL or more additional examination hearings , which shall be scheduled by the bankruptcy administrator pursuant to a proposal made by the creditors who have failed to submit their claims on time , and under the condition that they pay y advance of the costs of such a hearing in advance and within DATE .
( CARDINAL ) Claims submitted after the expiry of the above time - limits shall be declared inadmissible .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW ( Zakon o parničnom postupku ) obliges a civil court to stay the proceedings pending before it where the insolvency bankruptcy proceedings have been instituted against any of the parties to the civil proceedings .
